nodes.bodyText: please remove these 2 comments, your commit message should be enough to identify why it's there

Actually, I have a different opinion here. It is interesting that both are valid points from each perspective.
A person who is reading that line of code, and click blame to read through my commit message. But a casual reader will miss that.
True story, // support for azure is actually what made me stop and think about what might be going wrong in that function for GCP!

I have to say I would do it differently today, move that part to a method and give a meaningful name. If we add these comments to every part of the code then it will be outdated in a while etc. I still prefer avoiding comments as much as possible. Solving that issue and indicating with a comment was a mistake from my part.
Ok, I have removed those comments to move forward.
